abstract: While Japan is well known for its products in the auto and technology sectors, the same is not so true for the grocery business. Some companies are trying to change that.
snippet: While Japan is well known for its products in the auto and technology sectors, the same is not so true for the grocery business. Some companies are trying to change that.
lead_paragraph: TOKYO — Until he moved to Japan three years ago, Arturo Vega, a Spanish-language teacher, had no idea that the Sofyl brand of yogurt that he had bought in his native Mexico was made by Japanese company named Yakult Honsha.

headline.main: Japanese Food Companies Seek Growth Abroad
headline.print_headline: Japanese Food Companies Seek Growth Abroad
